item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "No good deed goes unpunished." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I can resist anything except temptation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. (Mr. Dumby, Act III)" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is no sin except stupidity." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There are moments when one has to choose between living one's own life, fully, entirely, completely-or dragging out some false, shallow, degrading existence that the world in its hypocrisy demands." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yet each man kills the thing he loves By each let this be heard Some do it with a bitter look Some with a flattering word The coward does it with a kiss The brave man with a sword" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "All oppression creates a state of war. And this is no exception." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Emmanoelle add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "One is not born a genius, one becomes a genius; and the feminine situation has up to the present rendered this becoming practically impossible." -- Simone de Beauvoir
